sunday.title: Introduction to Stellar Astrophysics
sunday.content: Explore the fundamental principles governing the life cycles of stars, from their birth in cosmic nurseries to their spectacular deaths. Understand the physics of stellar formation, nuclear fusion, and the intricate dance of gravity and radiation pressure.

sunday.title: Star Formation and Early Evolution
sunday.content: Witness the birth of stars within vast molecular clouds. Learn how gravity overcomes thermal pressure to create protostars, and follow their journey through the T Tauri phase to the main sequence. Discover the role of angular momentum and magnetic fields.

sunday.title: Main Sequence Stars and Nuclear Fusion
sunday.content: Delve into the heart of stellar engines where hydrogen fuses into helium through the proton-proton chain and CNO cycle. Understand hydrostatic equilibrium, energy transport mechanisms, and how mass determines a star's fate on the Hertzsprung-Russell diagram.

sunday.title: Stellar Evolution and Death
sunday.content: Journey through the final stages of stellar life. From red giants to white dwarfs, witness the dramatic death throes of massive stars in supernovae, and explore the exotic remnants: neutron stars and black holes. Understand nucleosynthesis and cosmic recycling.

sunday.title: Observational Techniques in Stellar Studies
sunday.content: Master the tools astronomers use to unlock stellar secrets. From spectroscopy revealing chemical compositions to interferometry mapping stellar surfaces. Learn about space telescopes, adaptive optics, and how we measure distances across the cosmic void.
